name: PostHog
headline: The single platform to analyze, test, observe, and deploy new features
description:
PostHog helps engineers build better products. We provide everything they need to make sure they are building something that people want. This means - product analytics, session replays, feedback tools, feature flags, experimentation, LLM observability, and a datawarehouse (with SQL) with one click data imports from the places you use.

We've been averaging ~10% monthly revenue growth, we are [default alive](http://www.paulgraham.com/aord.html), and we didn't raised a huge / now-overpriced round in 2021. While others are focused on layoffs and struggling to grow into huge valuations, we're focusing on an awesome product for end users, hiring (a handful of) exceptional team members and seeing fantastic increases in revenue as a result.

Check out posthog.com/careers if you want to be part of this journey.

founders.name: James Hawkins, Founder
founders.description:
cofounder at PostHog /
used to be a bad pro cyclist /
knows about brand (sounds fluffy right, my mom says i'm special though)/shipping lots of stuff/marketing to developers

# Howdevelopersbuildsuccessfulproducts
## The single platform to analyze, test, observe, and deploy new features
[Get started - free](https://www.posthog.com/<https:/us.posthog.com/signup>)[Talk to a human](https://www.posthog.com/</talk-to-a-human>)

Just starting out? [Explore our founder stack.](https://www.posthog.com/</founder-stack>)
## Product analytics
Understand user behavior with event-based analytics, cohorts, and conversion funnels. Includes auto capture & SQL access.
![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/contents/images/products/product-analytics/product-analytics-light)
![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/contents/images/products/product-analytics/product-analytics-dark)
  * Funnels
  * Graphs & trends
  * User paths
  * Stickiness
  * Lifecycle
  * Retention
  * SQL

1 million events

[![ResearchGate](https://www.posthog.com/static/researchgate-cececb60c2b3fec053a578c74579663f.svg)Customer story →Customer story →](https://www.posthog.com/</customers/researchgate>)[![PostHog - so meta!](https://www.posthog.com)How we use PostHog →How we use PostHog →](https://www.posthog.com/</blog/posthog-marketing>)

## 10+ products in one
Product engineering has never been so lit. Trade in your product & data stack for a single platform where everything is built to work together.
[Learn why this matters](https://www.posthog.com/</why>)
## We ship weirdly fast
We started with product analytics, but we've shipped 10+ products since then.
  * 2020
  * 2021
  * 2022
  * 2023
  * 2024
  * 2025

  * PostHog joins YC W20 batch

See 2021
Previous
### January 2020
Next
### PostHog joins YC W20 batch
PostHog was founded by James and Tim on January 23rd, 2020. We got into Y Combinator's W20 batch, moved to San Francisco, and just a couple of weeks after starting realized that we needed to build PostHog!
![Hogflix mobile](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/src/components/Home/images/hogflix-mobile)
### SDKs for web and mobile
#### Web (frontend)
Use autocapture to collect client-side events without any special instrumentation.
  * [![JavaScript](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/contents/images/docs/integrate/js)JavaScript](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries/js>)
  * [![React](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/contents/images/docs/integrate/react)React](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries/react>)
  * [![Next.js](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/contents/images/docs/integrate/frameworks/nextjs)Next.js](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries/next-js>)
  * [![Vue](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/contents/images/docs/integrate/frameworks/vue)Vue](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries/vue-js>)
  * [More](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/frameworks>)


#### Server-side libraries
Capture server-side events - best used in conjunction with a frontend web library
  * [![Node.js](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/contents/images/docs/integrate/nodejs)Node.js](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries/node>)
  * [![Python](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/contents/images/docs/integrate/python)Python](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries/python>)
  * [![Java](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/contents/images/docs/integrate/java)Java](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries/java>)
  * [![PHP](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/contents/images/docs/integrate/php)PHP](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries/php>)
  * [![Ruby](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/contents/images/docs/integrate/ruby)Ruby](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries/ruby>)
  * [![C#/.NET](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/dotnet_logo_7e446176f2)C#/.NET](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries/dotnet>)
  * [More](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries>)


#### Mobile libraries
Send custom events and identify users. Record mobile sessions and use feature flags.
  * [![Android](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/contents/images/docs/integrate/android)Android](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries/android>)
  * [![iOS](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/contents/images/docs/integrate/ios)iOS](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries/ios>)
  * [![React Native](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/contents/images/docs/integrate/react)React Native](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries/react-native>)
  * [![Flutter](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/contents/images/docs/integrate/flutter)Flutter](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries/flutter>)


[Browse all libraries](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/libraries>)
## Mmmm, code examples
Here's what you can do with the PostHog JS code snippet and your product.
[(Not using JavaScript?)](https://www.posthog.com/<https:/posthog.com/docs/getting-started/install?tab=sdks>)
  * Product OS
  * Product analytics
  * Session replay
  * Feature flags
  * Experiments


  * Track an event
`capture`
  * Identify a user
`identify``group`
  * Record a pageview
`capture`


## Warning: You'll hate PostHog if...
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/i_love_telemarketing_d72bc8079b)
##### You enjoy "jumping on a quick call" with sales
Sorry, we don't force you to talk to anyone. But you can [watch a recorded demo](https://www.posthog.com/</demo>) (at your own pace) or [request a personalized demo](https://www.posthog.com/</talk-to-a-human>) if you like.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/wasting_money_decf55197a)
##### You love needlessly wasting company money
We only have usage-based pricing that [decreases exponentially](https://www.posthog.com/</pricing>) with scale.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/try_buy_3c54a911c5)
##### You'd rather buy before you try
We offer a free tier so large that only a fraction of our customers pay us anything. Even worse, we continually try to [reduce our pricing](https://www.posthog.com/</blog/multi-product-pricing>).
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/bad_trade_81f36c9a2a)
##### You think your email is a good trade for that free whitepaper
Please press Ctrl + W now, or ask your network administrator to close your window.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/stranger_danger_eb6694e03d)
##### You give out your credit card details to strangers
You'd rather buy a product you've never used instead of a generous free trial?
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/commitment_issues_d433b343b5)
##### You're desperate for commitment
Sadly, we don't offer annual contracts (unless you [ask for one](https://www.posthog.com/</talk-to-a-human>)).
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/i_hate_change_6e54f0e9cc)
##### You loathe new features, and bug fixes
Unfortunately we release [new updates weekly](https://www.posthog.com/</changelog>).
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/mangle_ec73b24da8)
##### You'd rather buy disparate tools and mangle them together
Apologies. Our focus is for you to engineer your product, not your data.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/creative_suite_sucks_07b81c5a82)
##### You like buying a whole product suite to get access to one tool
Alas we don't force people to buy stuff they don't use. We suit people who want to pay by product.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/csms_ce310839fd)
##### You think CSMs are your friends
Honey, those emails are automated.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/training_c209c09991)
##### You enjoy sitting through hours of training more than using the product
No training is required to use PostHog, though we have plenty of [docs](https://www.posthog.com/</docs>) and [guides](https://www.posthog.com/</guides>) if you need some guidance.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/gdpwut_aaec809dca)
##### Data privacy isn't a big deal to you. (GDP-what now?)
Get cookie-less tracking, regional hosting, and raw database access.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/ru_bizdev_9fcd6556d0)
##### Networking events are your things
We put on an event once. It was a disaster. Never again.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/loop_hole_f5f7d3eb18)
##### You love being out of the loop
We publish our [roadmap](https://www.posthog.com/</roadmap>), [strategy](https://www.posthog.com/</handbook/company/strategy>), and [company handbook](https://www.posthog.com/</handbook>).
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/rolodex_b1aee8688d)
##### Your CRM is a Rolodex
We don't even use phones, though we do have a fax number for legal and compliance reasons.


## API
We built PostHog on our API. This means you get full access to anything you want with your event and customer data that's ingested by PostHog. Here are some examples.:
  * feature_flags
#### Evaluate feature flags from anywhere
If you don't use one of our [SDKs](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/getting-started/install?tab=sdks>), you can get a flag status for a user from the API on-the-fly.
  * insights
#### Pull basic site stats from saved insights
Show stats like _active users_ , _pageviews_ , or _number of daily signups_ (like we use near the bottom of this page!).
  * insights
#### User-facing analytics
Build your own visualizations of insights within your own app or internal dashboard.
  * persons
#### Read/write user properties and display in your app
Use PostHog as an external database by storing/reading user data and showing it in their user profile.
  * cohorts
#### Add high-value users to a cohort
If you're running Clearbit on new signups, you can automatically add them to a cohort based on criteria from enrichment services.
  * annotations
#### Notate when a feature is released
Annotations are useful for understanding inflection points in insights. You can programmatically create annotations like when a PR is merged.

[Explore the API](https://www.posthog.com/</docs/api>)
## HogQL
PostHog provides complete SQL access to your data. Use SQL expressions to use JOINs and subqueries, filter event lists, and write complex queries (that aren't supported by the PostHog UI) to analyze data in any way you want.
![A hog standing in front of mission control controls](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/src/components/Home/images/mission-control-hog)
**For example...**
  * Double (or even triple?) breakdowns
`concat(properties.name,' ; ',properties.$current_url)`
  * [Advanced date filtering](https://www.posthog.com/</tutorials/hogql-date-time-filters>), relative times, weekly/monthly reports
  * Custom SQL insights directly accessing data
  * Custom scoring or "group/bin" events
  * NPS score, superhuman score calculations
  * Access JSON, object, list data

[Learn more about SQL access](https://www.posthog.com/</blog/introducing-hogql>)
## Join our open source community
We work in the open. Check out our [company strategy](https://www.posthog.com/</handbook/strategy/overview>), [business model](https://www.posthog.com/</handbook/strategy/business-model>), or even our [source code](https://www.posthog.com/<http:/github.com/posthog/posthog>).
![campfire-light](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1718854771/posthog.com/campfire-light.png)![campfire-dark](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1718854772/posthog.com/campfire-dark.png)
## One platform, thousands of use cases
PostHog grows with you – from startups to growth stage and beyond.
  * ![Drake Hog](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/src/components/Home/images/mds)
### Replaces the modern data stack
With 10+ products on one platform, you'll spend less time engineering your data integrations and more time building your product.
  * ![Ballmer Hog](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/src/components/Home/images/tutorials-tutorials-tutorials)
### Tutorials, tutorials, tutorials!
Our community members use PostHog in ways we never imagined. (Some have even built entire products on our API.) Maybe we’ll write about yours next?
  * ![Graduate Hog](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/src/components/Home/images/hockeystick-growth)
### Guides for hockey-stick growth
We cover how products like ours went from pre-revenue to $100 million ARR - all in the open.


## Full control of your customer data
  * ##### Privacy controls
Track users without cookies, anonymize users, configure a reverse proxy
  * ##### Choose your hosting location
Store user data in the US or EU depending on your needs
  * ##### Full access to customer data
API offers total access to customer and event data
  * ##### Check out the source code
Audit the entire PostHog codebase on GitHub for compliance or just peace of mind


![](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/lipis/flag-icons/flags/4x3/us.svg)
###### US Cloud
Hosted in Virginia
![](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/lipis/flag-icons/flags/4x3/eu.svg)
###### EU Cloud
Hosted in Frankfurt
![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/v1/posthog.com/src/components/Home/images/host-hogs)
![Here's what's cookin', good lookin'](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_367/v1/posthog.com/src/components/Home/images/experiment-hog)
## The future of PostHog depends on you
### We publish our product roadmap. Tell us what we should build next – and get early access.
[Explore our roadmap](https://www.posthog.com/</roadmap>)
Under consideration
  * Messaging
  * End-user facing analytics (B2B2B/B2B2C)
  * Cookie banner product
  * Surveys in emails
  * Product tours
  * Customer support product
  * Alternative to Google Tag Manager
  * Clip recordings to the relevant parts + export as video/gif
  * Event-based flag targeting


In progress
  * No-code A/B testing
  * Error tracking
  * Webhook destination
  * Surveys for Mobile
  * Feature flags for Java
  * Cookieless web analytics
  * Unified role-based access control (RBAC)
  * Query / API / in app analytics
  * PostHog Customer Data Platform


![A billboard with Dalton Caldwell extolling how great PostHog is](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/q_100/v1/posthog.com/src/components/Home/images/billboard)
Startup program
### Get to product market-fit with the most popular analytics toolkit used by YC startups
  * **Huuuuge free tier**
30M events tracked + 50K recordings free, per month
  * **Exclusive founder merch**
Now you can look as lit as our engineers
  * **Pre-product/market fit guides**
We literally wrote a book on how to get product-market fit
  * **Used and recommended by**

[ Learn more](https://www.posthog.com/</startups>)

### January 2020

### PostHog joins YC W20 batch
PostHog was founded by James and Tim on January 23rd, 2020. We got into Y Combinator's W20 batch, moved to San Francisco, and just a couple of weeks after starting realized that we needed to build PostHog!
![Hogflix mobile⟨12⟩]
### SDKs for web and mobile
#### Web (frontend)
Use autocapture to collect client-side events without any special instrumentation.

## Warning: You'll hate PostHog if...
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/i_love_telemarketing_d72bc8079b)
##### You enjoy "jumping on a quick call" with sales
Sorry, we don't force you to talk to anyone. But you can watch a recorded demo⟨29⟩ (at your own pace) or request a personalized demo⟨8⟩ if you like.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/wasting_money_decf55197a)
##### You love needlessly wasting company money
We only have usage-based pricing that decreases exponentially⟨3⟩ with scale.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/try_buy_3c54a911c5)
##### You'd rather buy before you try
We offer a free tier so large that only a fraction of our customers pay us anything. Even worse, we continually try to reduce our pricing⟨30⟩.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/bad_trade_81f36c9a2a)
##### You think your email is a good trade for that free whitepaper
Please press Ctrl + W now, or ask your network administrator to close your window.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/stranger_danger_eb6694e03d)
##### You give out your credit card details to strangers
You'd rather buy a product you've never used instead of a generous free trial?
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/commitment_issues_d433b343b5)
##### You're desperate for commitment
Sadly, we don't offer annual contracts (unless you ask for one⟨8⟩).
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/i_hate_change_6e54f0e9cc)
##### You loathe new features, and bug fixes
Unfortunately we release new updates weekly⟨31⟩.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/mangle_ec73b24da8)
##### You'd rather buy disparate tools and mangle them together
Apologies. Our focus is for you to engineer your product, not your data.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/creative_suite_sucks_07b81c5a82)
##### You like buying a whole product suite to get access to one tool
Alas we don't force people to buy stuff they don't use. We suit people who want to pay by product.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/csms_ce310839fd)
##### You think CSMs are your friends
Honey, those emails are automated.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/training_c209c09991)
##### You enjoy sitting through hours of training more than using the product
No training is required to use PostHog, though we have plenty of docs⟨4⟩ and guides⟨32⟩ if you need some guidance.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/gdpwut_aaec809dca)
##### Data privacy isn't a big deal to you. (GDP-what now?)
Get cookie-less tracking, regional hosting, and raw database access.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/ru_bizdev_9fcd6556d0)
##### Networking events are your things
We put on an event once. It was a disaster. Never again.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/loop_hole_f5f7d3eb18)
##### You love being out of the loop
We publish our roadmap⟨33⟩, strategy⟨34⟩, and company handbook⟨35⟩.
  * ![](https://res.cloudinary.com/dmukukwp6/image/upload/c_scale,w_250/rolodex_b1aee8688d)
##### Your CRM is a Rolodex
We don't even use phones, though we do have a fax number for legal and compliance reasons.


## API
We built PostHog on our API. This means you get full access to anything you want with your event and customer data that's ingested by PostHog. Here are some examples.:
  * feature_flags
#### Evaluate feature flags from anywhere
If you don't use one of our SDKs⟨36⟩, you can get a flag status for a user from the API on-the-fly.
  * insights
#### Pull basic site stats from saved insights
Show stats like _active users_ , _pageviews_ , or _number of daily signups_ (like we use near the bottom of this page!).
  * insights
#### User-facing analytics
Build your own visualizations of insights within your own app or internal dashboard.
  * persons
#### Read/write user properties and display in your app
Use PostHog as an external database by storing/reading user data and showing it in their user profile.
  * cohorts
#### Add high-value users to a cohort
If you're running Clearbit on new signups, you can automatically add them to a cohort based on criteria from enrichment services.
  * annotations
#### Notate when a feature is released
Annotations are useful for understanding inflection points in insights. You can programmatically create annotations like when a PR is merged.

Explore the API⟨37⟩
## HogQL
PostHog provides complete SQL access to your data. Use SQL expressions to use JOINs and subqueries, filter event lists, and write complex queries (that aren't supported by the PostHog UI) to analyze data in any way you want.
![A hog standing in front of mission control controls⟨38⟩]
**For example...**
  * Double (or even triple?) breakdowns
`concat(properties.name,' ; ',properties.$current_url)`
  * Advanced date filtering⟨39⟩, relative times, weekly/monthly reports
  * Custom SQL insights directly accessing data
  * Custom scoring or "group/bin" events
  * NPS score, superhuman score calculations
  * Access JSON, object, list data

Learn more about SQL access⟨40⟩

## Full control of your customer data
  * ##### Privacy controls
Track users without cookies, anonymize users, configure a reverse proxy
  * ##### Choose your hosting location
Store user data in the US or EU depending on your needs
  * ##### Full access to customer data
API offers total access to customer and event data
  * ##### Check out the source code
Audit the entire PostHog codebase on GitHub for compliance or just peace of mind

generated_description:
PostHog is a dynamic startup founded in January 2020, emerging from Y Combinator's W20 batch, and based in San Francisco. With a team of about 85 people and led by co-founders James and Tim, the company is honing in on a singular mission: to provide a comprehensive platform for product development that enables analysis, testing, observation, and deployment of new features seamlessly.

Initially crafted to help engineers build better products, PostHog has evolved into an all-in-one tool offering features like product analytics, session replays, feedback tools, feature flags, experimentation capabilities, and more—all with effortless integration through a one-click data warehouse setup. The platform empowers teams to deeply understand user behavior with capabilities that include event-based analytics, cohorts, conversion funnels, and even SQL access for advanced data querying. 

Financially, PostHog is on an upward trajectory with an impressive average of around 10% monthly revenue growth. They are not just surviving; they’re thriving—having avoided the typical pitfalls that plagued many startups during the 2021 funding frenzy. The company is "default alive," meaning its revenue covers its operational costs, a hallmark of a sustainable business model.

What distinguishes PostHog is its commitment to community and customer-centricity. Their pricing structure is designed for scalability: it starts free for up to a million events a month, allowing small startups to grow without the pressure of immediate costs. For larger companies, the value proposition is competitive with the lowest pricing compared to their competitors in the market.

As a beacon of resilience in an industry often bogged down by volatility, PostHog focuses on building great products and hiring talented individuals instead of engaging in mass layoffs. They are also transparent about their development, actively publish their product roadmap, and invite users to influence their feature prioritization.

If you’re looking to join an innovative team that's not just about analytics but about crafting user-driven products within a vibrant startup culture, PostHog is currently hiring (check out their careers page at https://www.posthog.com/careers).

In summary, PostHog isn’t just software; it’s a robust platform for anyone looking to create products that resonate with users while keeping costs manageable. As they continue to expand their offerings and refine their products, it’s clear they’re not just in the game—they’re changing how products are built.

For more details, visit their website at https://www.posthog.com.
